questions.question: Explain the difference between descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics with examples.
questions.canonical_answer: Descriptive explains what happened, diagnostic explains why it happened, predictive forecasts future outcomes, and prescriptive recommends actions. Example: sales reports (descriptive), root-cause analysis (diagnostic), demand forecasting (predictive), pricing optimization (prescriptive).

questions.question: How do you handle missing or inconsistent data? Give specific techniques and examples.
questions.canonical_answer: I use removal, imputation (mean, median, mode), forward/backward fill, or model-based imputation. For inconsistencies, I standardize formats, fix duplicates, and apply validation rules.

questions.question: Which statistical tests would you use to compare two datasets and why?
questions.canonical_answer: Use t-test for mean comparison, chi-square for categorical differences, Mann–Whitney for non-normal data, and KS test for distribution comparison.

questions.question: Walk me through your process for analyzing a new dataset. What steps do you take from raw data to insights?
questions.canonical_answer: I clean the data, explore with EDA, visualize patterns, apply statistical analysis or models, and summarize insights with clear recommendations.

questions.question: Walk me through your process for analyzing a new dataset. What steps do you take from raw data to insights?
questions.canonical_answer: I begin with data profiling, clean and prepare the dataset, explore trends, run analyses or models, and convert findings into actionable insights.

questions.question: What tools and languages do you use for data analysis? How do you choose which one for a given task?
questions.canonical_answer: I use Python, SQL, Excel, Power BI, and Tableau. I choose based on task—Python for complex analysis, SQL for queries, Excel for quick checks, and BI tools for dashboards.

questions.question: Imagine a dataset shows a sudden drop in sales — outline how you would investigate the cause.
questions.canonical_answer: I verify the data, analyze time trends, segment customers/products, check external factors, review recent business changes, and talk to teams to pinpoint the cause.
